page.title: 03POPULATION-SPETCHLEY AREA
page.content: The population grew in the medieval period and reached a peak in the 19th century.Recent agricultural mechanisation has led to a decline in numbers.{Sneachill}village now has the largest population containing 37 households, mostly young families. In{Spetchley,}past and present employees of the estate now occupy the houses.Other tenants include professional people. {Churchill }is a much depleted village and contains isolated farms and cottages, which border on our grid. The population is of an older age bracket like Spetchley. {Bredicot,}judging by archaeological evidence, had a Roman population. By 1086 it contained 20 persons,in 1871, 68 persons but today only 30 people live there of a mixed age range.
